title: JSON Handling
subject: JavaScript
theory:
JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format.
It is basically text written with JavaScript object notation.

*   `JSON.parse()`: Converts JSON string -> JS Object.
*   `JSON.stringify()`: Converts JS Object -> JSON string.

examples.explanation: Note how Dates are converted to ISO strings.

common_mistakes.correction: JSON does NOT allow trailing commas. JS Objects do.

interview_questions.question: How to deep clone an object quickly?

practice_problems.problem: Convert JS object to formatted JSON string (pretty print).

real_world_use_cases.description: Almost all modern web APIs communicate using JSON.

exam_notes: JSON keys must be double-quoted strings.
summary: JSON is the universal language of data exchange on the web.
